medical_history.chief_complaint: Pain, swelling, erythema, and purulent drainage on the dorsum of the left long finger.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 4 days prior to presentation, with five instances of infected furuncles over several years. The lesion was unresponsive to outpatient therapy with oral cephalexin.
medical_history.family_history: Boyfriend had similar finger infections thought to be spider bites.
